title: Instructional Design to Promote Reflective Thinking for Solving Biomedical Device Design Problems

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Blended learning environment for pre-service/in-service teachers, including digital device-supported team collaboration and reflective journaling activities

learning_goals: Learners can systematically apply reflective thinking stages (pre-, process-, and post-reflection) to solve biomedical device design problems.
Learners can identify technical and ethical issues arising during the design problem-solving process, write reflective journals, and incorporate feedback.
Learners can analyze the design process of team projects through peer assessment and derive improvement strategies.

resources: Reflective Journal Template and Assessment Rubric
PBL Task Kit (e.g., Electronic Circuit Kit)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
